message:
Strong Condemnation and Gainsaying Statement to false and baseless reports on Chhatrashibir:

Bangladesh Islami Chhatrashibir strongly slated and passed a gainsaying statement to false and fabricated reports published in Dainik Kaler Kontho and Vorer Kagoj linking Chhatrashibir to drug dealings.
 

In a gainsaying statement, the Secretary-General of Bangladesh Islami Chhatrashibir Abdul Zabbar said, “Two Bangla dailies named Kaler Kontho and Vorer Kagoj intentionally published reports relating Chhatrashibir to drug dealings and these dailies followed the report of an online web portal which published the same thing yesterday. However, a gainsaying statement to that report from Chhatrashibir was also published yesterday. It is well-known to all the quarters that Chhatrashibir is the one and only student organization in Bangladesh which is completely free from drug practices and also works to keep the students away from drug dependencies. The brave leaders and activists of Chhatrashibir have been working at the plain risk as well as cost of their lives for the sake of the country and Islam and they will keep this tempo up InShaAllah. We even feel otherwise to gainsay such worst type of reports.”

He urged the concerned media and media men to refrain from publishing such false and fabricated reports in the coming days.
